subject: Re: Rig connexcted to antenna(not shown)
author: purplespacefriend
full_text:
Thanks! Yeah some of these are almost like it's not using the radio 
sounds, or using it so completely normal radio stations can't be 
heard. 

 Frank-S

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "dead.science" <dead.science@...> 
wrote:
>
> -I hear the clay earth part and I think I hear the go back. 
> I looked at clip in Audition and it is strange.  The loud portion or
> possible fragment is just over three times longer than any other
> portion of the clip.  This means it is either very very broad band 
or
> a very powerful transmission.  It is way to long in duration to be
> broadband.  The FCC would never let a signal this wide be 
broadcast. 
> And if its that powerful to saturate the front end of the receiver 
it
> would 1, be very close to you and 2, be heard all the time!  I think
> the fact that the time period of the signal is so much longer than
> that of the scan rate proves this is something else.
> I use this method on my minibox and it seems to be holding up.
> Rob.
> Deadscience.com
> -- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@> 
wrote:
> >
> > 
> >  This is kinda light blasted by the sunlight, but it's direct 
mode,
> no sound chamber, and using the lool antenna. There is one loud 
voice
> in the middle "go back to the clay earth"--or "go back the player" a
> broadcast frag?
